description: Chair with Spanish feet, wood with rush seat,(maple or beech?) Purchase 1914 The Dunwoody Fund; repurchased 1929 by Mrs. C.C. Bovey and given for the Josephine Koon Room
medium: Maple or beech with rush seat
text: The flared, hoof-like feet like those on this chair are often called "Spanish feet."  The name hints at the international spread of design elements - these feet are thought to have originated in Portugal.
title: Side chair, one of a pair
